cards.name: Planar Portal
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: These devices have been known to pull entire worlds through the Æther.
cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Skull of Orm
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Though lifeless, the skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.

rulings.text: Can bring back any enchantment.

cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Star Compass
cards.text:
Star Compass enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add one mana of any color that a basic land you control could produce.
cards.flavor: It doesn't point north. It points home.

rulings.text: If a basic land you control gains another basic land type or gains another ability that lets it produce mana, consider those effects when determining what colors of mana that land can produce.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Colorless is a type but not a color.

cards.originalText:
Star Compass comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color a basic land you control could produce.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in their hand on the bottom of their library in any order, then draws that many cards.

rulings.text: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards. (That player draws his or her card for the turn first.)

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Urza's Armor
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Urza protected his body well, but neglected his soul.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect, and prevent the 1 damage to you only.
It is a prevention effect applied when damage would be dealt.

cards.originalText: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

cards.name: Vexing Arcanix
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player chooses a card name, then reveals the top card of their library. If that card has the chosen name, that player puts it into their hand. Otherwise, they put it into their graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to them.

rulings.text: If the player has no cards in their library, the effect does nothing. It does not cause any damage.
The target player names a card on resolution.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's the named card, the player puts it into his or her hand. Otherwise, the player puts it into his or her graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Coastal Tower
cards.text:
Coastal Tower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
cards.flavor: A beacon in the night, a dream in the fog.
cards.originalText:
Coastal Tower comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Elfhame Palace
cards.text:
Elfhame Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.
cards.flavor: The elfhames are the closest thing to "civilization" the elves allow themselves.
cards.originalText:
Elfhame Palace comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Salt Marsh
cards.text:
Salt Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
cards.flavor:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying
cards.originalText:
Salt Marsh comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Shivan Oasis
cards.text:
Shivan Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.
cards.flavor: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.
cards.originalText:
Shivan Oasis comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Urborg Volcano
cards.text:
Urborg Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.flavor: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.
cards.originalText:
Urborg Volcano comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} instead.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the 'training' I needed."

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor:
"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis

cards.name: Sea Eagle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

cards.name: Enormous Baloth
cards.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

cards.name: Silverback Ape
cards.flavor: It does not wear a crown or sit on a throne of gold, but those who have witnessed its power hail it nonetheless.

cards.name: Angelic Page
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"A battle's outcome is never certain."
—The Southern Paladin

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

cards.originalText: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor:
". . . Our castle's strength
Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare,
Macbeth
cards.originalText: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Cloudchaser Eagle
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.

rulings.text: It destroys one of your enchantments if you are the only player with any enchantments.
Nothing happens if there are no legal enchantments to target when it enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle comes into play, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Crossbow Infantry
cards.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Twang. You're dead.
cards.originalText: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the 'training' I needed."

cards.name: Elite Archers
cards.text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.
cards.originalText: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.
cards.originalText: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"North and South meet and angels sing.
Voices resound with a righteous ring."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Heavy Ballista
cards.text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."
—Ballista captain
cards.originalText: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Honor Guard
cards.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.
cards.originalText: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Intrepid Hero
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.

rulings.text: The power of the creature is checked on activation and on resolution. If the targeted creature's power is not 4 or greater on resolution, the ability doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

rulings.text: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

cards.originalText: {T}: All combat damage that unblocked creatures would deal to you this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

cards.name: Knighthood
cards.text: Creatures you control have first strike.
cards.flavor: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have first strike.

cards.name: Longbow Archer
cards.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Longbow Archer may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Master Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"How smooth his face, how sure his thoughts. I look forward to breaking his mighty will."
—The Eastern Paladin
cards.originalText: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Without warriors there can be no war.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Pariah
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
cards.flavor: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.

rulings.text: You can attach this to an opponent's creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

cards.originalText: All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

cards.name: Purify
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin
cards.originalText: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.

cards.name: Razorfoot Griffin
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Fear this no more!"
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor: "Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.originalText: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain that much life.

cards.name: Rolling Stones
cards.text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."
—Onean sergeant
cards.originalText: Walls may attack as though they weren't Walls.

cards.name: Sacred Ground
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.
cards.originalText: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls puts a land into your graveyard from play, return that land to play.

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"Kubla Khan"
cards.originalText: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Sanctimony
cards.text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

rulings.text: Gaining life is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent taps a mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

cards.originalText: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Serra Advocate
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Serra Angel to tap.

cards.name: Serra's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
cards.flavor:
"With one breath, the newborn angel took to the air . . . and the world sighed."
—The Book of Serra
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and attacking doesn't cause it to tap.

cards.name: Shield Wall
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."
—Onean veteran
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Skyshroud Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: The earliest mystics believed that the falcon slit the sky to let the light break through.

rulings.text: No it is not a Falcon creature type. It is a Bird.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Skyshroud Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Southern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
cards.flavor:
"How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"
—The Western Paladin
cards.originalText: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The noble paladins draw strength from the courage of others.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Standing Troops to tap.

cards.name: Starlight
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"Even in the darkest night
Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme
cards.originalText: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Staunch Defenders
cards.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."
—The Southern Paladin
cards.originalText: When Staunch Defenders comes into play, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Sunweb
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Sustainer of the Realm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.

rulings.text: It gets the bonus only once, not once per creature it blocks.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "I rely not so much on the wisdom of age as on the overconfidence of youth."
cards.originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, you gain 2 life.
